brewery.brewery_description: We are a brand new Brewery and Visitor centre, complete with Tap House & Kitchen, in Historic buildings with a waterside location in Gosport, Hampshire. The first two beers we have created are being brewed under our control whilst we build our brewery. The Hop & Hooker beers are named after England World Cup winning Hooker Steve Thompson MBE, who is part of our team.

beer.beer_description: Monkey's Charge is a double dry-hopped pale ale bursting with mango and tropical fruit flavours from two hop charges of Azacca and Amarillo. It pours with a bright golden haze and a soft malt body.

Drop Anchor is a pale ale with a base of Vienna malt, this higher-kilned malt gives the beer a fuller body with a bready and toasted character. A dry-hop combination of Citra and El Dorado bring an onslaught of tropical fruit to make for an insanely juicy and crushable beer.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 145 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 30!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 120 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 25.
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 380 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 77.

beer.beer_description: Monkey's Charge is a double dry-hopped pale ale bursting with mango and tropical fruit flavours from two hop charges of Azacca and Amarillo. It pours with a bright golden haze and a soft malt body.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 230 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 47!

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 25 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 6!

user.bio: Never used to like beers until forced by a friend to drink Newcastle Brown Ale. Now, 26 years on I like hoppy IPAs

beer.beer_description: Monkey's Charge is a double dry-hopped pale ale bursting with mango and tropical fruit flavours from two hop charges of Azacca and Amarillo. It pours with a bright golden haze and a soft malt body.

items.badge_description: Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 270 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 55.

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 420 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 85!

beer.beer_description: West Coast

Drop Anchor is a pale ale with a base of Vienna malt, this higher-kilned malt gives the beer a fuller body with a bready and toasted character. A dry-hop combination of Citra and El Dorado bring an onslaught of tropical fruit to make for an insanely juicy and crushable beer.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 320 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 65!

beer.beer_description: A refreshing pale ale that showcases cascade hops which give a floral and citrus aroma with notes of lychee. Caramel malts lend body and a hint of sweetness  while still letting the cascade hops sing.

Inspired by our recent voyage to Australia this DIPA leads with Australian ‘Galaxy’ hops that bring an intense tropical aroma with notes of peach and passionfruit, supported by Bru-1 and Nelson Sauvin that lend a slightly sharper pineapple and grapefruit character. The beer is devoid of bitterness and carries a smooth, juicy body.
West Coast

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 220 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 45!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 40 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 9.

beer.beer_description: Explosion IPA is an authentic West Coast IPA using the classic 'C' hops that helped launch the craft beer revolution. A punchy hop aroma of pine and citrus leaps out the glass, light crystal malt in the body is pushed aside by an assertive bitterness to give a thirst-quenching finish.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 30 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 7!

items.badge_description: Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 180 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 37.

items.checkin_comment: Deleted my previous poor check in for this Fest Bier as it's actually pretty decent .

beer.beer_description: This traditional lager carries a full body with a golden colour and bready flavour, with a subtle caramel sweetness from the use of CaraHell and Vienna malts. German hops provide a light floral notes in the aroma while a clean fermentation profile produces a beer that is effortlessly drinkable despite its higher alcohol content.

Drop Anchor is a pale ale with a base of Vienna malt, this higher-kilned malt gives the beer a fuller body with a bready and toasted character. A dry-hop combination of Citra and El Dorado bring an onslaught of tropical fruit to make for an insanely juicy and crushable beer.

user.location: Newport in the Soviet Rep. of Wales.

beer.beer_description: Monkey's Charge is a double dry-hopped pale ale bursting with mango and tropical fruit flavours from two hop charges of Azacca and Amarillo. It pours with a bright golden haze and a soft malt body.

Drop Anchor is a pale ale with a base of Vienna malt, this higher-kilned malt gives the beer a fuller body with a bready and toasted character. A dry-hop combination of Citra and El Dorado bring an onslaught of tropical fruit to make for an insanely juicy and crushable beer.

Explosion IPA is an authentic West Coast IPA using the classic 'C' hops that helped launch the craft beer revolution. A punchy hop aroma of pine and citrus leaps out the glass, light crystal malt in the body is pushed aside by an assertive bitterness to give a thirst-quenching finish.

Drunken Sailor is a rich breakfast stout which uses a combination of 8 different malts and lactose for a complex and smooth body. This base of chocolate and caramel is elevated by specially selected Brazilian coffee beans which give an aroma of caramel and dark fruits.

A refreshing pale ale that showcases cascade hops which give a floral and citrus aroma with notes of lychee. Caramel malts lend body and a hint of sweetness  while still letting the cascade hops sing.

Lemondrop and Calypso hops bring a bright citrus aroma in this bright citrus aroma in this refreshing pale ale with notes of lemon zest and apple, and a clean crisp character. A clean and simple malt body allows the hops to shine and a rounded bitterness gives a refreshing finish.

This Rye IPA has a sweet centre of caramel malts that will complement the natural caramelisation of any grilled, marinated meats. The aroma is bursting with tropical and stone fruit flavours from a dry-hop of Motueka and Ekuanot. Pairs well with all meats and the hop notes and slightly drying finish will particularly accentuate spice.

An easy-drinking Munich Helles that has a malt sweetness and subtle bready character from layers of Munich and Vienna malt. An all-German hop profile perfectly balances the malt with a soft bitterness and a fresh fruit aroma from late additions of Huell Melon and Mandarina Bavaria.
A toffee and caramel malt backbone with a delicate fruit aroma. There is a slightly drying finish from the amber malt that accentuates the bitterness.

A light and refreshing pale ale showcasing New Zealand hops that bring a white grape and gooseberry aroma, reminiscent of a Sauvignon Blanc with subtle floral notes. This beer has been designed to pair with lighter dishes such as seafood and chicken where delicate flavours can be teased out and highlighted by the fragrant hop aroma.

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description: Nectaron, Bru-1 and Mosaic hops combine in this impactful double IPA that has an intense tropical fruit aroma that leads with pineapple and passionfruit, above am underlying dank character. Revolutionary liquid dry-hopping techniques elevate the flavour and aroma while keeping a smooth and soft body.

Inspired by visits to The Mary Rose Museum and the spices that can be found on display, this unique pale ale brings and intriguing aroma with savoury notes of cracked pepper and spice combining with bright citrus fruits.
Wheat and oats in the body of the beer lends a bready sweetness which is complemented by the savoury yeast profile.

beer.beer_name: EMBRACE - RHUBARB & HIBISCUS SOUR - IWD COLLAB X RUTH HANSOM
beer.beer_description: Embrace is our first sour beer, bursting with rhubarb flavour that is complemented by the addition of hibiscus flowers which lend subtle notes of cranberry and redcurrant. The malt profile lends a smooth body that combines with vanilla for a touch of sweetness, helping soften the beer before giving way to a refreshingly tart finish.

Cutlass - Black Forest Gateau Stout 5.8 %

Tasting Notes: 

A complex malt profile lends the rich cakey mouthfeel in this stout with layered flavours of biscuit, caramel and dried fruit. 
Sour morello cherries ? and cocoa nibs then elevate the flavour and aroma to recall the decadent dessert that inspired the beer.

Bravo Zulu is a classic

German pilsner produced with Nova lager yeast, the clean fermentation profile gives an effortlessly drinkable, crisp and refreshing lager. Tettnang and Hallertau Blanc hops in the whirlpool lend a slightly. fruity and floral hop aroma with subtle notes of white grape and spice.

Using a traditional and clean berliner weisse as a base we have loaded this beer with raspberry puree that brings flavour in abundance as well as a striking pink colour. The wheat base helps round out the body while the sourness from the beer and tart character of the raspberry lend a refreshing finish.
An all English pale ale, with hints of tangerine, apricot

A complex malt profile lends the rich, cakey mouthfeel in this stout with layered flavours of biscuit, caramel and dried fruit. Sour morello cherries and cocoa nibs then elevate the flavour and aroma to recall the decadent dessert that inspired the beer.

This traditional lager carries a full body with a golden colour and bready flavour, with a subtle caramel sweetness from the use of CaraHell and Vienna malts. German hops provide a light floral notes in the aroma while a clean fermentation profile produces a beer that is effortlessly drinkable despite its higher alcohol content.
This rye IPA has a sweet centre of caramel malts. The aroma is bursting with tropical and stone fruit flavours from a dry-hop of Motueka and Ekuanot with a  slightly drying finish.
